actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Amhara Regional Special Forces
notes: On 19 March 2021, Amhara regional special forces (LIYU) in Senbete town (Oromo zone, Amhara region) reportedly shot and killed 5 Oromo civilians, wounding 10 more.

actor2: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Amhara Regional Special Forces
notes: On 19 March 2021, clashes between Amhara regional (Liyu) forces and Oromo militias sparked a day earlier in Jillo Tumuga (coded separately) spread to Ataye, Kebele 01, 02 and 03 (Ataye town, North Shewa, Amhara region), with Oromo ethnic militias attacking Amhara regional special forces positions in Ataye town. By Friday evening, according to a local administrator, the town of Ataye was in full control of the Oromo militias. Amhara officials blame the attack on the OLF/Shane group, citing heavy weapons used by the attackers. Officials later confirmed 303 fatalities, 369 injuries, and 1,539 burned homes. Fatalities spread across 14 known events and locations.

On 11 March 2021, dozens of secondary students protested after completing examinations in Shashamane town (Arsi, Oromia), demanding the release of political prisoners. The students were arrested, with some being beaten badly enough to be admitted to a local hospital. [size=dozens]

Around 10 March 2021 (month of), the occurrence of conflict across Tigray was ongoing from Nov 4 2020 and into 2021. The details of the exact events are not known, but active conflict locations were discerned via field interviews. ACLED recorded the dates of the ongoing early conflict to represent the ongoing violence. All locations affected by violence are repeated for Mar 10 and Mar 20. These are estimates of the ongoing and repeated clashes between the ENDF/EDF and the Tigrayan forces, represented by TPLF/TDF. Event reportedly occurred in or around Ielaca (North Western, Tigray).

actor1: OLF: Oromo Liberation Front (Shane Splinter Faction)
notes: On 9 March 2021, at least 20 ethnic Amhara civilians were shot and killed by OLF/Shane militants in Jaret Jargeda Horo Dadi kebele (Horo Gudru Welega, Oromia). Location coded to the largest town in vicinity (Alibo).

source: Amaro Woreda Government Communication Affairs Office
notes: On 8 March 2021, a communal militia from neighboring west-Gujji zone (Gelena Woreda) shot and killed 6 people, including the Prosperity Party candidate, in Amaro Woreda, SNNPR during a peace meeting involving local administrators from both zones. Location of the event was Dano Kebele (could not be found), location coded to a town bordering the Amaro/Gelena kebele administrative zones (Chirme, Amaro, SNNPR).

actor1: OLF: Oromo Liberation Front (Shane Splinter Faction)
notes: On 6 March 2021, 22 ethnic Amhara civilians were killed and several others wounded by suspected OLF/Shane militants in Dabis Kebele, Abe Dongoro (Horo Gudru Welega, Oromia). Some sources reported as many as 29 fatalities during the event, fatality count coded to the most conservative report.

actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Oromo Regional Special Forces
notes: On 5 March 2021, Oromia regional special forces shot and killed a high school student in Akayu, Jarte Jardega kebele (Horo Gudru Welega, Oromia). According to sources, the student was arrested shortly before tests, beaten severely, and then taken to his hometown where he was shot and killed. Location coded to the largest town in vicinity (Alibo).

Around 3 March 2021 (week of), continued clashes between TPLF and associated forces and Ethiopian defense forces were reported in the Asgede woreda area (North Western Tigray, Tigray). Location estimate based on information received (approximate). No further information.

Around 3 March 2021 (week of), continued clashes between TPLF and associated forces and Ethiopian defense forces were reported in the Edaga Arbi area (Indama Tsahma, Central Tigray, Tigray). Approximate estimate of location based on information received. No further information.

Around 3 March 2021 (week of), continued clashes between TPLF and associated forces and Ethiopian defense forces were reported in the Gijet area (Southern Tigray, Tigray). No further information.

actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Oromo Regional Special Forces
notes: Around 3 March 2021 (week of), in West Hararghe zone, Chiro woreda (West Hararghe, Oromia), a father of three children was taken from his home and beaten to death by Oromo regional Special police.

Around 3 March 2021 (week of), continued clashes between TPLF and associated forces and Ethiopian defense forces were reported in areas west of Endamehoni area (Aywera, Southern Tigray, Tigray). No further information.

On 2 March 2021, Eritrean soldiers reportedly opened fire on civilians in a market in Azebo town (Eastern, Tigray), killing an unspecified number of people. Unknown fatalities conservatively estimated at 3.
On 2 March 2021, heavy fighting was reported between Eritrean soldiers and TPLF forces in areas 'west of Adigrat' (Eastern Tigray, Tigray). No further information.
On 26 February 2021, Ethiopian forces shot and killed 26 Gumuz civilians in Albasa kebele of Dibate Woreda (Metekel, Benishangul/Gumz).
Around 26 February 2021 (as reported), Oromo civilians in Gandaqorqa kebele (Kamashi zone, Benishangul/Gumz) were arrested and beaten by local police. One man later died of his injuries.

actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Oromo Regional Special Forces
notes: Around 25 February 2021 (as reported), federal troops shot and killed a suspected member of OLF/Shane (reportedly unarmed) in Burqua Dhintu (West Hararghe, Oromia). No further details. Location coded to the nearest settled area, Megala.

actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Oromo Regional Special Forces
notes: On 25 February 2021, Oromia regional special forces reportedly shot and killed a young man in 01 area of Shashamane town (Arsi, Oromia).

Around 24 February 2021 (week of), three government force members were killed and seven others were wounded during an attack by unidentified armed men at a place called Tulu Dimtu near Dibate (Metekel, Benishangul/Gumz).
On 24 February 2021, clashes were reported between ENDF forces and Tigray Militias in Gijet (Southern Tigray, Tigray). No information on casualties.
On 24 February 2021, unidentified armed men shot and killed 3 civilians in Zematya kebele (Wembera, Metekel, Benishangul-Gumz).
On 24 February 2021, Murle gunmen from South Sudan and local militia in Bandera kebele, Dimma woreda (Anyuak zone, Gambella) engaged in short clashes, resulting in injuries.

Property destruction: Around 24 February 2021 (as reported), federal troops operating under a command post reportedly destroyed 35 houses in Lalo Kabele (Kelem Wolega, Oromia) accusing the residents of supporting OLF/Shane.
On 23 February 2021, an unidentified armed gunmen shot and killed 10 people in Harbu kebele (Wembera, Metekel, Benishangul/Gumz).
On 23 February 2021, 80 people were shot and killed by Eritrean troops in May Weini, located near Gijet (Southern Tigray, Tigray).

On 23 February 2021, a battle between Eritrean forces and local Tigray militiamen allied with TPLF forces was fought near the town of May Weini, Tigray region (located near Gijet). No further information.
On 23 February 2021, Eritrean soldiers reportedly shot and killed 6 civilians in Saesi Tsaedaemba (Eastern Tigray, Tigray).

On 21 February 2021, clashes were reported between unidentified armed gunmen and security forces in Kiremu (East Wolegga, Oromia). Injuries were reported, no fatalities specified. At least 8 militants were captured following the clashes.
On 21 February 2021, clashes were reported between Amhara and Gumuz ethnic militias in Gunguam woreda (Awi, Amhara) [coded to Chagni]. One fatality was reported.

These are estimates of the ongoing and repeated clashes between the ENDF/EDF and the Tigrayan forces, represented by TPLF/TDF. Event reportedly occurred in or around Kuskwam (Southern Tigray, Tigray).

source: University of Ghent Tigray Conflict Atlas
notes: Around 20 February 2021 (month of), the occurrence of conflict across Tigray was ongoing from Nov 4 2020 and into 2021. The details of the exact events are not known, but active conflict locations were discerned via field interviews. Event reportedly occurred in or around Feresmay (Central Tigray, Tigray).
On 19 February 2021, at least one person was killed when an unidentified armed gunmen threw a grenade into a government office in Nekemt town (East Wolegga, Oromia).
On 18 February 2021, unidentified armed gunmen clashed with security forces in Gelana woreda (Gujji, Oromia). At least two members of security forces were killed in the clash.
On 18 February 2021, unidentified gunmen attacked a kebele administration office in Dembi Dolo, (Kelem Wollega), sparking clashes with local police. No further information.

On 18 February 2021, TPLF forces and allied militiamen attacked a bus of students traveling from Mekele to Addis Ababa as it passed through Adi Mesno (Southern, Tigray), killing 6 students as well as 2 federal police escorts. Several other students were injured in the attack.
On 17 February 2021, at least one person was reportedly killed by an unidentified armed group in Chancho kebele (Dibate, Metekel, BSG).
On 17 February 2021, TPLF forces attacked an electrical power transfer station in Adi Gudem (Southern, Tigray) using explosives, cutting electrical transfer through the Alamata-Mehoni-Mekele line.
On 17 February 2021, an unidentified armed man shot and killed the Liban kebele chairperson in Liban woreda (Gumi Eldelo, East Gujji). No further details.
On 17 February 2021, unidentified gunmen clashed with local security forces following the killing of a local council member in Liben (Gumi Eldelo, Guji, Oromia). No further information reported.
On 16 February 2021, protesters demonstrating against a pro-government rally in Senbete town, Jjile Timuga Woreda (Bati, Oromo zone) were arrested by police. [size=no report]
On 16 February 2021, an unidentified armed group ambushed security forces in Aba Sina (Gimbi district, West Wellega zone, Oromia). No further information.
On 16 February 2021, unidentified armed men clashed with security forces in Gumola woreda (Borana, Oromia). At least three people were killed during the clash.

On 15 February 2021, 6 people were abducted by an armed group in the Aba Sina forest area of Gimbi (West Wollegga, Oromia) as they traveled in an ambulance from Asosa to Addis Ababa. 2 of the abducted were later released.

On 15 February 2021, federal troops and TPLF forces plus allied local militiamen clashed in heavy battles near the town of Chili, located near Gijet, (Southern Tigray, Tigray). No further information.

On 15 February 2021, Ethiopian federal troops attacked the village of Chile following heavy clashes with TPLF forces (coded separately), killing about 180 people who were suspected of supporting the TPLF during the battle. Chile is located near the village of Gijet (Saharti Samre, Samri).
Around 15 February 2021 (month of), Ethiopian air forces jets conducted airstrikes against TPLF targets in Gijet. No information on fatalities.
On 15 February 2021, clashes between ethnic Afar and Somali militias reported in Mile Woreda, (Mile, Zone 1). No fatalities reported in the clash.
On 15 February 2021, at least 12 people were reportedly killed by an unidentified armed group in Bereber kebele (Dibate, Metekel, BSG).
Around 15 February 2021 (month of), Eritrean soldiers raped, and then shot and killed a woman in Wikro (Eastern, Tigray).
Around 15 February 2021 (month of), an aid worker was killed by an unidentified armed group in Selekleka town (North-Western, Tigray).

actor2: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Benishangul-Gumuz Regional Special Forces
notes: On 15 February 2021, unidentified armed gunmen reportedly shot and killed a member of the special forces in Zadia kebele, Guba woreda of Metekel zone. No further information.

actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Amhara Regional Special Forces
notes: Around 15 February 2021 (month of), a 13-year-old girl was gang raped by Amhara regional special forces in her home in Humera city (Western Tigray, Tigray). Her family took her for medical treatment, but they were shot and killed while on route to the hospital (coded separately).
On 14 February 2021, police forces and local militia reportedly assaulted ONLF election teams in Gode zone, Somali region, causing injuries. No fatalities reported.

assoc_actor_2: EZEMA: Ethiopian Citizens for Social Justice
notes: On 14 February 2021, unidentified armed group shot and killed a chairperson of the Ethiopian Citizens for Social Justice (EZEMA) in Bishoftu (Debre Zeyit, East Shewa, Oromia).
On 14 February 2021, clashes between ethnic Afar and Somali militias reported in Adaar woreda (Awsi zone, Afar) [coded to Eli Wuha]. No fatalities were specified by the source.

On 14 February 2021, police forces arrested and assaulted a young man after he advocated for the release of Oromo prisoners during a graduation ceremony at Jimma University (Jima, Oromia). The young man appeared in court the next day with bruises and swelling.

On 13 February 2021, clashes erupted between suspected OLF/Shane (OLA) members and police forces in Melka Jebdu town (Dire Dawa, Dire Dawa). One fatality was reported, with three other people injured.
On 12 February 2021, for a second day, clashes erupted between the local militias and suspected Gumuz gunmen in Wogdi kebele, (Wembera, Metekel). No further details reported.

On 12 February 2021, students in Ginir (Ginir, Bale, Oromia) held a demonstration in support of the opposition Oromo political prisoners currently on hunger strike. The demonstration was reportedly dispersed by security forces. [size=no report]

On 12 February 2021, students in Adama held a demonstration in support of the opposition Oromo political prisoners currently on hunger strike in Nazreth (Adama, East Shewa). The demonstration was reportedly dispersed by security forces. [size=no report]
On 12 February 2021, demonstrations were held in Warder city (Welwel & Warder, Somali) in response to the arrest of several ONLF officials the day before. [size=no report]

On 12 February 2021, students in Shashamane (Arsi, Oromia) held a demonstration in support of the opposition Oromo political prisoners currently on hunger strike. The demonstration was reportedly dispersed by security forces with one person injured. [size=no report]

On 12 February 2021, unidentified ethnic militants attacked ethnic Amhara in a rural area of Gurafarda (Bench Sheko, SNNP), killing an unspecified number of civilians and burning houses. Unspecified fatalities coded as 3.

On 11 February 2021, protests that began in Mekelle the previous day (coded separately) spread to Adwa (Central Tigray, Tigray). Demonstrations were called after a delegation of religious and political leaders arrived in the city following military operations, with residents denouncing the military operations and subsequent food shortages. [size=no report]

On 11 February 2021, protests that began in Mekelle the previous day (coded separately) spread to Aksum (Southern Tigray, Tigray). Demonstrations were called after a delegation of religious and political leaders arrived in the city following military operations, with residents denouncing the military operations and subsequent food shortages. [size=no report]

On 11 February 2021, protests that began the previous day (coded separately) continued in Mekele city (Southern Tigray, Tigray region). Demonstrations were called after a delegation of religious and political leaders arrived in the city following military operations, with residents denouncing the military operations and subsequent food shortages. [size=no report]
On 11 February 2021, unidentified armed men attacked a bus traveling in Sherkole Wereda (Assosa zone, Benishangul/Gumz). One person was killed, with several others injured.
On 11 February 2021, fighting erupted between local militias and suspected Gumuz gunmen in Wogdi kebele, (Wembera, Metekel). No further details reported.
Around 11 February 2021 (week of), Ethiopian soldiers shot and killed 18 people in Wikro (Eastern Tigray, Tigray).

On 11 February 2021, demonstrators in Shire (Western Tigray, Tigray) clashed with federal troops who advanced to disperse crowds. Two demonstrators were killed by federal forces. Demonstrations were called after a delegation of religious and political leaders arrived in the city following military operations, with residents denouncing the military operations and subsequent food shortages. [size=no report]

On 9 February 2021, demonstrators blocked roads in Mekele town (Southern Tigray, Tigray) and clashed with federal soldiers occupying the city. 5 people were killed when security forces opened fire. Demonstrations were called after a delegation of religious and political leaders arrived in the city following military operations, with residents denouncing the military operations and subsequent food shortages. [size=no report]

actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Oromo Regional Special Forces
notes: On 8 February 2021, 17 militants of an unidentified armed group were killed in Western Oromia (coded as Dembi Dolo, West Wolegga) by Oromia regional special troops. 3 additional militants were captured in the operation.

On 8 February 2021, local security forces clashed with an unidentified armed group in Gimbi, in Fentale woreda (Metehara, East Shewa, Oromia). One civilian bystander was reportedly killed in the crossfire.
On 7 February 2021, clashes between Afar and Oromo ethnic militias in Selena kebele, Bati woreda (Bati, Oromia zone of Amhara region) resulted in the death of 2 people.

On 6 February 2021, 400 secondary students in Shashamane town (Arsi zone, Oromia) demonstrated against the continued detainment of political prisoners, demanding their release and an end to political instability in Oromia. Police forces intervened and dispersed the crowd, leaving a few people injured. 30 students were arrested. [size=400]

On 6 February 2021, 150 secondary students demonstrated in Yabelo (Borana zone, Oromia). The demonstrators clashed with security forces, who opened fire and killed one person. The demonstration was against the continued detainment of political prisoners and political instability in Oromia. [size=150]

On 6 February 2021, clashes were reported between Afar and Amhara ethnic forces in Raya Kobo woreda (Kobo, North Wello, Amhara). One person on the Amhara side was reportedly killed before security forces intervened to stop the clashing.
On 6 February 2021, state forces clashed with an unidentified armed group in the Hawuda area of Dola Mena woreda (Bale zone, Oromia). Two fighters were killed.

On 6 February 2021, protesters in Dire Dawa town (Dire Dawa) demonstrated against the continued detainment of political prisoners, demanding their release and an end to political instability in Oromia. [size=no report]

On 6 February 2021, secondary high school students in Gimbi (West Wolegga, Oromia) protested, demanding justice for a popular Oromo musician who had been assassinated last year, the release of Oromo political prisoners, and a return to normalcy. The organizers of the protest along with some teachers were arrested. [size=no report]

On 6 February 2021, protesters in Asabot town (West Harerghe, Oromia) demonstrated against the continued detainment of political prisoners, demanding their release and an end to political instability in Oromia. [size=no report]
On 6 February 2021, security forces clashed with an unidentified armed group in Buke Tobara kebele of Mana Sibu (Mendi, West Wolegag, Oromia). No fatalities mentioned by the source.

On 6 February 2021, protesters in Dembi Dolo town (West Wellega, Oromia) demonstrated against the continued detainment of political prisoners, demanding their release and an end to political instability in Oromia. [size=no report]

On 6 February 2021, protesters in Nekemt town (East Wellega, Oromia) demonstrated against the continued detainment of political prisoners, demanding their release and an end to political instability in Oromia. [size=no report]

On 6 February 2021, protesters in Kersa town (East Hararghe) demonstrated against the continued detainment of political prisoners, demanding their release and an end to political instability in Oromia. [size=no report]

On 6 February 2021, protesters in Weliso town (South West Shewa, Oromia) demonstrated against the continued detainment of political prisoners, demanding their release and an end to political instability in Oromia. [size=no report]

On 5 February 2021, secondary students protested in Ambo town (West Shewa, Oromia) against the continued detainment of Oromo political leaders and the lack of a proper investigation into the killing of a popular Oromo singer some months ago. 40 students were arrested by police forces who dispersed the protest. [size=at least 40]
On 5 February 2021, a demonstration was held in Nekemt (East Wellega, Oromia) by students, demanding the release of Oromo prisoners. [size=no report]

On 5 February 2021, a demonstration was held in Batu [Ziway] (East Shewa, Oromia), with demonstrators demanding the release of Oromo prisoners and facing off with pro-Abiy demonstrators. [size=no report]
On 5 February 2021, a demonstration was held in Dire Tayara (East Hararghe, Oromia) by Oromo Qeerroo youth demanding the release of Oromo prisoners. [size=no report]
On 5 February 2021, security forces clashed with an unidentified armed group in Jidola, Gorodola woreda (East Guji, Oromia). 2 members of the security forces were reportedly wounded.
On 5 February 2021, a demonstration was held in Aweday (East Hararghe, Oromia), by Oromo Qeerroo youth demanding the release of Oromo prisoners. [size=no report]
On 5 February 2021, local residents demonstrated in Gambella town (Agnuak, Gambella), demanding that development projects resume. [size=no report]

Weapons seizure: On 3 February 2021, 15 armed individuals with explosives were caught by police as they prepared to attack the UAE embassy in Addis Ababa (Coded to Bole, Addis Ababa). No injuries reported, several explosives were seized during the operation.
On 1 February 2021, a school teacher was shot and killed by security forces in Ayana (East Welegga, Oromia) after being accused of having links to OLF/Shane.
On 1 February 2021, security forces shot and killed an unarmed man in Alemaya (East Hararghe, Oromia)

actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Oromo Regional Special Forces
notes: On 1 February 2021, Oromo special forces shot and killed an unarmed man in Dembi Dolo (Kelem Wolegga, Oromia)

actor2: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Oromo Regional Special Forces
notes: On 29 January 2021, protesters wearing yellow and demonstrating in Kullubi town (East Hararghe, Oromia) were arrested by police forces. Protesters denounced the continued detainment of Oromo political prisoners. [size=no report]

actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Oromo Regional Special Forces
notes: On 29 January 2021, Oromia regional special police reportedly shot and injured a young man in Tula (East Hararghe, Oromia) after accusing him of being a member of OLF/Shane.
Movement of forces: Around 28 January 2021 (as reported), Ethiopian troops moved heavy weapons, including anti-aircraft guns, into areas along the Sudanese border (Abderafi, North Gondar, Amhara).

Around 27 January 2021 (as reported), security forces clashed with armed members of the Kawariya Islamic movement in Dola Mena Woreda, (Bale zone, Oromia). One person was killed. The Kawariya movement is accused of having links to the Islamic State.

actor2: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Oromia State Police
notes: On 27 January 2021, protesters associated with the Qeerroo movement who gathered in Dire Tayara (East Hararghe, Oromia) were dispersed by police forces after around 2 hours of demonstrating. Protesters denounced the continued detainment of Oromo political prisoners. [size=no report]

actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Oromo Regional Special Forces
actor2: OLF: Oromo Liberation Front (Shane Splinter Faction)
notes: On 27 January 2021, Oromia regional special police clashed with OLF/Shane militants in Limu Seka Woreda (Atnago, Jimma Zone, Oromia). The bodies of 6 militants were later found in a river near the clash.

actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Oromo Regional Special Forces
actor2: OLF: Oromo Liberation Front (Shane Splinter Faction)
notes: On 27 January 2021, Oromia regional special police clashed with OLF/Shane militants in Yeti Koniqa Kebele, Anfilo woreda (West Wollega, Oromia). No further details about the clash are available.

Property destruction: On 25 January 2021, federal troops reportedly destroyed 25 houses in Dembi Genji (Dembi Dolo, West Wollega) after accusing the inhabitants of supporting the OLF/Shane militant movement.

On 23 January 2021, Sudanese troops shelled Ethiopian military positions in Abderafi, Mirab Armacho (north Gondor Zone, Amhara) in reponse from a shelling conducted earlier by Ethiopian forces. No casualties were reported.

Headquarters or base established: On 21 January 2021, the House of Peoples' Representatives decided to adopt the State of Emergency declared on Tigray State to Metekel zonal administration of Benishangul Gumuz State. This meant the establishment of federal troops into the Metekel zone of Benishangul/Gumz state (Gilgel Belles, Metekel, Benshangul-Gumaz).

Arrests: On 18 January 2021, police forces announced the arrest of some 300 people, including 70 civil servants, in Konso zone (SNNPR) following continued ethnic clashes in the area.

actor2: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Oromia State Police
notes: Arrests: Around 17 January 2021 (as reported), 'measures' were taken against around 1,000 Oromia state police officers who had allegedly worked with the OLF. 'Measures' usually refer to arrests in this context. Location coded to the Oromia state capital of Nazreth (Oromia).
On 15 January 2021, at least 11 civilians were shot and killed by Ethiopian forces in Mahibere Dego (Central Tigray, Tigray).

Around 15 January 2021 (month of), 52 instances of rape in Mekelle, 22 in Adigrat, 7 in Wukro and 27 in Ayder (a total of 108) involving unidentified actors have been reported to health facilities. Perpetrators were not identified.

Around 15 January 2021 (month of), 52 instances of rape in Mekelle, 22 in Adigrat, 7 in Wikro and 27 in Ayder (a total of 108) involving unidentified actors have been reported to health facilities. Perpetrators were not identified.

Around 15 January 2021 (month of), reported instances of civilians being injured by Eritrean forces as they looked for remaining Tigray Defence Soldiers (TPLF associated) in rural areas of Aksum (Southern, Tigray).
Around 15 January 2021 (month of), Ethiopian air forces reportedly conducted airstrikes in the Kola Tambien village area. No further information.
Around 15 January 2021 (month of), clashes reported between TPLF forces and Ethiopian military troops in Kola Tambien (Central, Tigray). No further information.
Around 15 January 2021 (month of), clashes reported between Eritrean forces and Tigray Defence forces (TPLF) in unspecified locations west of Shire (Southern, Tigray). No further information.

Around 15 January 2021 (month of), 52 instances of rape in Mekele, 22 in Adigrat, 7 in Wukro and 27 in Ayder (a total of 108) involving unidentified actors have been reported to health facilities. Perpetrators were not identified.
Around 15 January 2021 (month of), clashes reported between TPLF forces and Ethiopian military troops in Samre (Southern, Tigray). No further information.
On 15 January 2021, hundreds of protesters in Angar Guti and Bonya Bushe (Gutin, West Wollega), demonstrated against OLF/Shane militants operating in the zone. [size=hundreds]

On 14 January 2021, unidentified armed men shot and killed two Oromo civilians during seperate attacks in Jille Dhumuga and Dawe Woredas in North Wollo (Kemise, Oromo zone of Amhara). Clashes have been occurring between Afar and Oromo militias in the area, although it is unclear if this incident is part of the conflict.

On 14 January 2021, Ethiopian federal forces and allied communal militias reportedly engaged in clashes with armed ethnic militias responsible for killing civilians in the Dibate area (Benishangul) days before. Several were reported killed. Unspecified fatalities in a non-conflict zone coded as 3 and spread across two dates.

On 14 January 2021, Ethiopian federal forces and allied communal militias reportedly engaged in clashes with armed ethnic militias responsible for killing civilians in the Dibate area (Benishangul) days before. Several were reported killed. Unspecified fatalities in a non-conflict zone coded as 3 and spread across two dates.

On 13 January 2021, Ethiopian federal forces fought battles against TPLF forces near the Tekeze river (Mekele, Tigray), killing 4 high ranking members of the TPLF's administration and army. 4 Ethiopian federal soldiers, 1 civil servant, and an unknown number of bodyguards were also killed in the clash. Unknown fatalities coded as 3 - fatalities estimated at a total of 12 persons.
On 13 January 2021, 27 ethnic Amhara civilians were killed by attacking ethnic militias in Cheliya kebelle in Metekel zone (Benishangul Gumuz).
On 12 January 2021, unidentified armed attackers killed about 80 ethnic Amhara civilians in Dilletti village, near Dibate Kebele of Metekel zone (Benishangul Gumuz).
On 11 January 2021, 11 Amhara civilians were killed in an attacked by ethnic militias in Guba, Metekel (Benishangul, Gumz).

On 11 January 2021, unidentified ethnic militias attacked civilians in four kebeles in Konso zone (SNNP), Toro, Buso, Afufo and Mekersa kebeles, over three days resulting in the death of the nine civilians and critical injuries of three. Fatalities spread across 3 days.

On 9 January 2021, unidentified ethnic militias attacked civilians in four kebeles in Konso zone (SNNP), Toro, Buso, Afufo and Mekersa kebeles, over three days resulting in the death of the nine civilians and critical injuries of three. Fatalities spread across 3 days.

actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Oromo Regional Special Forces
notes: On 8 January 2021, a health worker was shot dead by Oromo special forces near Dalati, in Dale Wabera (West Wellega, Oromia). No further information reported.

On 8 January 2021, 4 high-ranking members of the TPLF and an unspecified number of bodyguards and car drivers were killed during clashes with Ethiopian federal troops in Tigray region (Mekele, Tigray). Unspecified fatalities coded as 3 (total of 7 fatalities).
On 8 January 2021, a civilian was shot and killed by Ethiopian military forces inear Debeso, in Nole Kaba woreda (West Wellegga, Oromia).
On 7 January 2021, a military command post was established in Mekele (Tigray).

On 7 January 2021, hundreds residents held a protest denouncing violent actions of OLF/Shane in the West Wollegga towns of Sibusa, Baro teta, Kananisa, and Burkat alo woredas (locations could not be found, protests coded up to the capital Dembi Dolo, Oromia). [size=hundreds]

On 7 January 2021, Eritrean soldiers reportedly shot and killed 63 civilians in Aletena and Enamosana Kebeles of Irob zone, Tigray region. Event took place on 6-7 January, fatalities split between two days.

Around 6 January 2021 (between 3 - 9 January), continued clashes between Ethiopian Federal forces and unspecified armed gunmen occured in the outskirt areas of Mekele, Sheraro and Shire towns of Tigray region.

Around 6 January 2021 (between 3 - 9 January), continued clashes between Ethiopian Federal forces and unspecified armed gunmen occured in the outskirt areas of Mekele (Tigray), Shiraro and Shire towns of Tigray region.
On 6 January 2021, 16 people, including civilians and members of the national defense forces, were killed in Wembera woreda, Begondi kebelle (Benishangul/Gumz) during an attack by ethnic militias.

On 6 January 2021, Eritrean soldiers reportedly shot and killed 63 civilians in Aletena and Enamosana Kebeles of Irob zone, Tigray region. Event took place on 6 and 7 January, fatalities split between two days.

Around 6 January 2021 (between 3 - 9 January), continued clashes between Ethiopian Federal forces and unspecified armed gunmen occured in the outskirt areas of Mekele, Shiraro and Shire towns of Tigray region.
On 5 January 2021, suspected Ethiopian military forces shot and killed at least 30 civilians and wounded 2 others in the Mai Harmaz village, Debre Abay (North Western, Tigray).
On 5 January 2021, a young man with suspected ties to the OLF/Shane group was shot and killed after being taken from his cell by security forces in Boji Dirmaji, West Wollega (Oromia).
On 5 January 2021, residents of Bila, Boji Durmaji staged a demonstration against OLF/Shane militants. [size=no report]

On 1 January 2021, hundreds of Muslim demonstrators in Harar city (Hundene, Harari People), demonstrated after Friday prayers after learning that the historically significant Al-Najashi mosque had been damaged by shelling during military operations. Harari city police dispersed the crowd by firing automatic weapons in the air (no injuries). [size=hundreds]
On 1 January 2021, 4 people were killed and 5 others wounded when Somali militia members attacked Mieso (Oromia).
On 1 January 2021, 3 farmers were shot and killed by security forces in Najo, West Wollegga. No further information reported.

actor2: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Oromia State Police
notes: On 1 January 2021, police opened fire on rioters at a church in Nekemt, East Wollegga, after violence erupted following overcrowding at the church. One person was killed as a result of the rioting, with 8 others injured. [size=no report]

On 31 December 2020, a joint operation of federal police and Ethiopian military clashed with TPLF forces in a remote area of Tigray region (exact location unknown, Mekele selected), resulting in the death of 18 high-ranking TPLF military officials. 96 other TPLF -related officials were arrested in the same operation.

On 29 December 2020, an explosive device detonated in Addis Ababa, killing 1 child and injuring others.

actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Prison Guards
notes: On 29 December 2020, a prisoner being held in Shashamane (Oromia) was reportedly beaten to death by prison guards.
On 29 December 2020, a student was shot and killed by federal soldiers in Gammachis Woreda of West Wollega. Location could not be found, coded to zone capital (Dembi Dolo, Oromia).

On 28 December 2020, state communications in Benishangul/Gumz region announced the killing of ''more than 300'' militants during police operations in Metekel zone (Gilgel Belles chosen as nearest location) following clashes and attacks on civilians in the area. Region officials were arrested and 200 weapons were seized.

actor2: OLF: Oromo Liberation Front (Shane Splinter Faction)
notes: On 28 December 2020, Ethiopian federal forces engaged with OLF/Shane fighters in West Wellegga (Dembi Dolo, Oromia), claiming to have killed 104, including a leader in the movement. Location of the clashes was not specified.

actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Afar Special Forces
actor2: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Somali Regional Special Forces
notes: On 27 December 2020, Afar Regional Special Forces reportedly attacked a Somali Regional State Special Forces' camp in Danlahelay in Somali Regional state in Afdem Woreda, Sitti Zone, resulting in 39 unconfirmed deaths.

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Afar Special Forces
notes: On 26 December 2020, Somali regional special forces attacked areas of Gewane, zone 3 of Afar zone, sparking clashes with local militia and allied Afar region special forces which resulted in an unspecified number of fatalities. Unknown fatalities coded as 3.

assoc_actor_2: Amhara Ethnic Group (Ethiopia); Oromo Ethnic Group (Ethiopia); Shinashan Ethnic Group (Ethiopia); Farmers (Ethiopia)
notes: On 25 December 2020, Gumz ethnic militias attacked Amhara/Oromo/Shinashan civilian farmers in Dibate woreda, Siren Kebele. No fatalities were specified.
On 24 December 2020, Ethiopian federal forces shot and killed 42 unidentified armed gunmen who reportedly took part in killing civilians in Bekuji, near Gilgel Belles (Metekel zone).

assoc_actor_2: Amhara Ethnic Group (Ethiopia); Oromo Ethnic Group (Ethiopia); Shinashan Ethnic Group (Ethiopia); Farmers (Ethiopia)
notes: On 23 December 2020, militants from an unidentified ethnic militia attacked ethnic Amhara, Oromo, and Shinile farmers in Bekoji in Bulen woreda in Metekel zone, killing at least 207 people.

On 23 December 2020, Oromo and Afar communal militias clashed in border areas between the Oromo Special zone of Amhara region and Afar region, resulting in an unspecified number of fatalities. Location chosen as Bati. Clashes were reportedly fought over disputed territory. Unknown fatalities coded as 3.
On 20 December 2020, an explosive device detonated in Lideta sub city (Addis Ababa, Addis Ababa) killing 3 people and wounding 5 more.

actor2: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Amhara Regional Special Forces
notes: On 19 December 2020, suspected militants from the Benishangul region reportedly attacked police in Guangua woreda in Awi Zone (Amhara region), leaving two members of the Amhara regional special forces and one militia member dead.

actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Oromo Regional Special Forces
actor2: OLF: Oromo Liberation Front (Shane Splinter Faction)
notes: Arrests: Around 19 December 2020 (as reported), 782 suspected OLF/Shane members were reportedly arrested in Guliso woreda of West Wellegga zone by regional security forces during a crackdown operation.

On 17 December 2020, unidentified men from an ethnic militia attacked ethnic Amhara civilians in Dibate and Dangur woredas, Metekel zone, killing an unspecified number of people. Unknown fatalities coded as 3 in a non-conflict zone and spread across two locations.

On 17 December 2020, unidentified men from an ethnic militia attacked ethnic Amhara civilians in Dibate and Dangur woredas, Metekel zone, killing an unspecified number of people. Unknown fatalities coded as 3 in a non-conflict zone and spread across two locations.

actor1: OLF: Oromo Liberation Front (Shane Splinter Faction)
notes: Around 15 December 2020 (as reported), more than 20 civilians, some reportedly ethnic Oromo civilians, were killed in Nejo Oromia region and Amuro (coded separately), by OLF affiliated splinter factions. 20 fatalities split between two events.

actor1: OLF: Oromo Liberation Front (Shane Splinter Faction)
notes: Around 15 December 2020 (as reported), more than 20 civilians, reported to be ethnic Amhara, were killed in Amuru and Nejo (coded separately) zones, Oromia region, by OLF/Shane militants. No further details. 20 fatalities split between two events.
Around 15 December 2020 (month of), 2 children were killed and a third injured in Tamben (Kola Tambien, Tanqua Abergele, Central Tigray) when a landmine they were playing with detonated.

Around 15 December 2020 (month of), Amhara ethnic militiamen shot and killed at least 3 people, including a young child, and wounded several others in Western Tigray province. No further information. Location coded to Humera, the capital of the zone.
Around 15 December 2020 (month of), Eritrean soldiers shot and killed a pharmacy worker and several members of his family (total fatalities estimated at 3) in Shire town, Tigray region.

Around 15 December 2020 (month of), an artillery shell fired by an unidentified group hit a house in Hawzen (Hawzen, Eastern Tigray), killing an unspecified number of people and wounding three children. Unspecified fatalities coded as 3.

actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Oromo Regional Special Forces
notes: On 14 December 2020, Oromia regional special forces reportedly shot and killed a civilian after pulling him from his house in Amuru, West Wolegga.

Around 14 December 2020 (as reported), at least 3 people were shot and killed by Ethiopian federal troops and Eritrean military forces in Mekele (Tigray) for allegedly breaking national coronavirus curfew rules. No further details reported.
Around 14 December 2020 (as reported), battles between the Ethiopian federal troops and forces allied to the TPLF continued in areas outside of Mekele (Tigray). No further information reported.

actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Oromo Regional Special Forces
notes: On 14 December 2020, Oromia regional special forces reportedly shot and killed 6 youths in Nejo, West Welegga, during an operation.

On 12 December 2020, Oromia state police reportedly took two students from a testing center in Jimma Genet, Horo Guduru Zone (Oromia), and shot and killed one, while wounding the second in a wooded area nearby.

source: University of Ghent Tigray Conflict Atlas

Around 9 December 2020 (as reported), clashes between the Ethiopian federal troops and TPLF forces continued in areas outside of Mekelle, Sheraro (Tigray) and Axum.

Around 9 December 2020 (as reported), clashes between the Ethiopian federal troops and TPLF forces continued in areas outside of Mekelle, Sheraro, and Aksum (Tigray). No additional information available.
Around 9 December 2020 (as reported), clashes between the Ethiopian federal troops and TPLF forces continued in areas outside of Mekele (Tigray), Sheraro, and Axum. No further information reported.

On 8 December 2020, unidentified armed men attacked ethnic Amhara in Dibate (Benshangul-Gumaz) as they attempted to gather harvests. 10 civilians were killed, all ethnic Amhara. Some Amhara groups blamed elements of the Oromo Liberation Army, although government sources deny this allegation.

Around 7 December 2020 (as reported), TPLF forces launched an attack against Ethiopian federal troops in the Raya-Wajirat area (Hintalo Wejirat, Tigray), claiming to have destroyed a mechanized division. Unknown fatalities in a conflict zone coded as 10.

On 7 December 2020, two young men were reportedly taken from their homes and killed by police officers in a wooded area near their home in Horo Gudura zone, Habeebee woreda, after being accused of supporting OLF/Shane.
On 6 December 2020, Ethiopian forces shot at and then detained UN staff near Sheraro (Tigray) after they refused to stop at a checkpoint. No injuries occurred.
Around 4 December 2020 (as reported), 14 people were reportedly killed in Gimbi, West Wollegga, by federal forces. Event assumed to have taken place during the week of the 4th of December.
On 3 December 2020, clashes were reported between TPLF and military in areas surrounding Mekele. No further information.
On 3 December 2020, Ethiopian soldiers entered a house in Abiy Adi (central Tigray, Tigray), looking for TPLF fighters and then shooting and wounding an older man.

On 2 December 2020, Eritrean soldiers shot and killed at least 20 people at the Goda glass bottle and share company in Gu'iguna (coded to Idaga Hamus, Eastern Tigray, Tigray) after forcing them to help loot the factory.
On 2 December 2020, clashes were reported between the TPLF and military in areas surrounding Mekele. No further information.
On 2 December 2020, gunmen from an unidentified armed ethnic group opened fire on a bus as it traveled from Chigna to Gilgel Belles (Meteke, Benishangul/Gumz), wounding 7.
On 2 December 2020, an Ethiopian civilian who resisted attempts by Eritrean soldiers to steal vehicles was reportedly shot dead in Adwa, Tigray region.
On 2 December 2020, a explosive of unidentified origin exploded in Bole sub city, Ethiopia, wounding one man.
Around 1 December 2020 (week of), Ethiopian soliders reportedly beat a man as he tried to stop them from raping a woman (coded in separate event) in Mekele (Southern Tigray, Tigray).

actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Oromo Regional Special Forces
notes: On 1 December 2020, Oromia regional special police opened fire on two brothers in Iddooroo Jirma village, Kiltu Karra, (West Welega), killing one and wounding the other seriously.
Around 1 December 2020 (month of), 81 young men were reportedly killed by Eritrean forces in Wikro (Eastern Tigray, Tigray).

notes: On 29 November 2020, Oromia regional special police reportedly shot and killed a teacher who was traveling through Jarso, West Welega (Oromia) (location coded as Dilla).

On 29 November 2020, Eritrean soldiers went house to house in Aksum (Southern, Tigray) following an ambush attack on their position, killing at least 200 people over the course of two days. Fatalities spread across two dates.
Around 28 November 2020 (weekend of), shelling by Ethiopian federal troops in the city of Mekele killed at least 27 civilians and injured 100 more.

Around 28 November 2020 (as reported), Ethiopian soldiers reportedly assaulted a man, breaking his legs in a town near Himora, Western Tigray. The victim suggested that the attack occurred in late November, and claimed that additional civilians had been killed (number not specified). Unspecified fatalities coded as 3.
On 28 November 2020, the Ethiopian army chief announced that the Ethiopian defense forces were in full control of the city of Mekele after clashes with the TPLF. No fatalities were reported.

On 28 November 2020, Eritrean soldiers went house to house in Aksum (Southern, Tigray) following an ambush attack on their position, killing at least 200 people over the course of two days. Fatalities spread across two dates.
On 28 November 2020, pro-TPLF militiamen attacked Eritrean soldiers occupying Aksum (Southern, Tigray), prompting heavy fighting. Unspecified fatalities in an active conflict environment coded as 10.
Around 28 November 2020 (week of), Eritrean soldiers reportedly raped an ethnic Tigrayan woman in Wikro (Eastern Tigray, Tigray).
On 27 November 2020, Ethiopian defense forces took control of the town of Hawzan after battling TPLF forces in the area. No information on casualties.
On 27 November 2020, Ethiopian defense forces took control of the town of Wikro after battling TPLF forces in the area. No information on casualties.
Arrests: On 27 November 2020, federal police announced the arrest of 469 persons accused of supporting the OLF in North Shewa, Oromia.

Around 26 November 2020 (as reported), unidentified armed men from an ethnic militia attacked ethnic minorities in Bulen, Dibate, Mandura, and Dangur (Benishangul/Gumz) woredas, killing an unspecified number. Unknown fatalities in an active conflict zone coded as 10 and spread across 4 locations.

Around 26 November 2020 (as reported), unidentified armed men from an ethnic militia attacked ethnic minorities in Bulen, Dibate, Mandura (Benishangul/Gumz), and Dangur woredas, killing an unspecified number. Unknown fatalities in an active conflict zone coded as 10 and spread across 4 locations.

On 26 November 2020, unidentified armed men from an ethnic militia attacked ethnic minorities in Bulen (Benishangul/Gumz), Dibate, Mandura, and Dangur woredas, killing an unspecified number. Unknown fatalities in an active conflict zone coded as 10 and spread across 4 locations.

Around 26 November 2020 (as reported), unidentified armed men from an ethnic militia attacked ethnic minorities in Bulen, Dibate (Benishangul/Gumz), Mandura, and Dangur woredas, killing an unspecified number. Unknown fatalities in an active conflict zone coded as 10 and spread across 4 locations.
Weapons seizure: Around 25 November 2020, federal police disarmed a landmine that had been planted by unidentified persons near a mosque in Sebeta town, Oromia region.
Arrests: Around 24 November 2020, federal police in Addis Ababa arrested 796 persons accused of plots supporting the TPLF and its operations in the north.
On 24 November 2020, a young man who had previously been arrested was found dead in Ambo city. It is unclear if he was killed by police or other forces after being released.
On 23 November 2020, TPLF forces launched a missile at Bahir Dar airport. No casualties were reported.

On 22 November 2020, Ethiopian defense forces took control of the town of Adigrat after battling TPLF forces in the area. Some civilians were reported wounded, no other information on casualties was available.
Around 22 November 2020 (week of), Ethiopian soldiers reportedly raped 6 women in Adigrat (Eastern Tigray, Tigray).
On 21 November 2020, Eritrean military forces reportedly killed 'dozens' of civilians in Idaga Hamus after taking control of the town following battles with TPLF forces.

On 21 November 2020, Eritrean military forces clashed with TPLF militias in Idaga Hamus, Eastern Tigray, taking control of the town shortly after. An unknown number of Eritrean forces were reportedly killed during the battle - unknown fatalities coded as 10 in an active conflict zone.

source: Ethiopia State of Emergency Fact Check
notes: Around 21 November 2020, ENDF forces took control of Adigarat after battling Tigray forces in the area. No information on fatalities.
Around 20 November 2020, Eritrean forces reportedly arrested 26 people in the Hitsats refugee camp (Western Tigray, Tigray) and took them to an unknown location.
Around 20 November 2020, TPLF associated Tigray ethnic militiamen shot and killed 9 Eritrean civilians (refugees) in the Hitsats camp (Western Tigray, Tigray).

On 20 November 2020, TPLF forces fired two rockets at the Bahir Dar airport, causing damage. No injuries or fatalities were reported.

Around 20 November 2020, Eritrean soldiers reportedly shot and killed 12 young men in Adigrat, accusing them of working with the TPLF. No information on casualties. Exact date is unknown, although it is thought to have occurred sometime in late November.

On 19 November 2020, Ethiopian and Eritrean troops shelled Aksum city, damaging buildings and homes. At least 29 fatalities were reported by local residents, with others who were seriously wounded.

On 19 November 2020, Eritrean and Ethiopian forces shot and killed at least one woman in Aksum (Southern Tigray, Tigray).
On 19 November 2020, an airstrike conducted by the Ethiopian military during operations against the TPLF struck Mekele University (Tigray), killing one student and wounded 21 others.

On 19 November 2020, heavy fighting between Eritrean troops and TPLF forces was reported around Shimelba camp (near Sheraro, Western Tigray). An unspecified number of refugees were killed as the camp was caught in the crossfire. Unknown fatalities in a combat zone coded as 10.
Around 19 November 2020, Ethiopian federal forces were in total control of the Chercher town (Southern Tigray) after battling TPLF forces in the area. No reports on fatalities.

Around 15 November 2020 (between 10 - 20 November), unidentified armed men attacked civilians in areas of Konso zone, Southern Nations, Nationalities and Peoples Region's (SNNPR) Konso Zone and surrounding areas of Ale Woreda, Segen Area Kebeles, Buniti Kebele of Amaro Woreda. A report issued by the Ethiopian Human Rights Commission later claimed that the violence in Konso in the specified areas resulted in 66 deaths. Fatalities spread across 3 events.

Most fatalities are attributed to police action against rioters, with additional fatalities occurring as rioter violence against ethnic Amhara living in the Oromia region. [size=no report]

On 20 March 2020, Oromo militants attacked pastoralists in Dharcaseeye and Gabagab, situated on the outskirts of Tuliguuleed, sparking clashes. One Somali pastoralist was wounded in the exchange of gunfire.
On 19 March 2020, government troops attacked 'Fano' (Amhara Youth) camps in Gondar, sparking an exchange of gunfire and clashes that left at least three people dead.
On 19 March 2020, locals held a demonstration in Borana zone, Borbor woreda, demanding that the woreda administrator be removed from power. [size=no report]
On 19 March 2020, Oromo militants attacked Somali pastoralists in Tuluguleed, sparking clashes. One Somali pastoralist was killed in the clash.
Property destruction: On 18 March 2020, militias sponsored by the Ogadan district administration attacked ONLF offices in Ogadan district, near Kebri Dehar (Korahe, Somali), and tore down the flag.
On 14 March 2020, residents held a protest in Sokota town, Wag Hamra, denouncing the delay of the trial of an official accused of corruption. [size=no report]

Around 12 March 2020, At least 11 people were killed during armed confrontations between Oromo and Afar pasturalists in the Bordeda (Mieso) area. Clashes are attributed to a dispute over water and pasture.

On 11 March 2020, rioting youth attacked a church at Anawari Ketama in North Shewa (Amhara), burning equipment on allegations that they were hosting several openly gay foreign doctors to provide eye surgeries. Several people were injured by the rioting youth and taken to the hospital. [size=no report]
On 10 March 2020, an IED exploded in a field in Mahal Meda town, North Shewa, killing 3 people and injuring several others. The wounded were taken to a hospital in nearby Debre Birhan.

On 6 March 2020, armed men opened fire on a park ranger patrol in the Babile Elephant sanctuary (East Harerghe, Oromia), killing 1 ranger and injuring 3 others. 3 members of the armed forces were also injured in the shootout.

On 3 March 2020, a man wearing a bomb detonated it during prayers at the Anjabara Orthodox church in Anjabara town, Amhara region. The bomber and his wife were killed, with 8 others injured. Motives behind the attack are unknown, and do not appear to be linked to jihadism.
On 3 March 2020, unidentified men armed with sticks and clubs attacked three regional judges in Durbete, Amhara region. The judges were later hospitalized, two with serious injuries.
On 2 March 2020, unidentified attackers stabbed the director of the Dhegahbur Hospital, located in Dhegahbur zone of Somali regional state. The victim survived.
On 2 March 2020, Afari militants crossed the regional border and attacked ethnic Somali livestock herders in Masalu town in Sitti zone (Somali), killing one.

On 2 March 2020, Oromo armed men shot and injured three ethnic Somali civilians in the town of Sheikh Sayid Cumar near Tulu Guleed (Fafan, Somali). All three were hospitalized in Tulu Guleed following the attack.

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Amhara Regional Special Forces
notes: On 2 March 2020, unknown persons attacked a police inspecting vehicle with a bomb in Sanja town (North Gondor, Amhara), killing a police officer and the person driving the car. Following the explosion, a civil servant, and a member of Amhara region's special (liyu) police were killed in an exchange of gunfire (source unclear where gunfire originated).

Between 16 Februarary and 20 March 2020, unarmed civilians were reportedly shot by Ethiopian military forces in Mugi, Anfilo Woreda, resulting in dozens of fatalities. The vicitims were usually young Oromo men suspected of being associated with the OLF.

On 29 February 2020, people who came to meet Oromo Federal Congress officials for a discussion in Adama city (Nazreth) protested after being denied entry to the venue by police forces. [size=no report]

On 28 February 2020, security forces opened fire on protesters in Tum town, Bench Maji woreda, killing 6. Protesters had flooded the streets, demonstrating against the recent arrest of woreda officials by federal troops. [size=at least 6]
On 26 February 2020, salt mine workers in Afar zone, Afdera woreda protested after a company executive recently accused of a violation was dropped from a prosecution list. [size=no report]

On 25 February 2020, a hand grenade was thrown by unidentified attackers at a police station in Ginchi, Oromia region. 2 officers were later treated for smoke inhalation, but no major injuries were reported.
On 24 February 2020, Oromo militias attacked the Somali town of Tuliguuleed in a night time raid, sparking clashes with local militiamen. At least one Somali was killed.

On 23 February 2020, an unidentified assailant threw a grenade into a rally in support of Abiy Ahmed and the Prosperity Party in Ambo. Many people and horses were injured in the attack, no fatalities reported.

21 February 2020: Thousands of people gathered in Hawassa (Sidama, Southern Nations), demonstrating their support of PM Abiy Ahmed and his Prosperity Party in addition to the successful referrendum and creation of Sidama state. [size=thousands]

notes: 21 February 2020: the police commissioner of Borayyu city and the the head of the Oromia state special police force were ambushed by unidentified gunmen while eating at a cafe in Borayyu. The police commissioner was killed while the head of Oromia special forces was seriously injured.

20 February 2020: Supporters of the Prosperity Party (PP) clashed with people opposed to PM Abiy Ahmed during a march/demonstration in Aweday, Oromia region. Police forces intervened to stop the violence, firing weapons in the air to disperse rioters. Several people were hospitalized. [size=at least several]

actor2: OLF: Oromo Liberation Front (Shane Splinter Faction)
notes: In late February 2020, Governement troops battled OLF splinter faction soldiers led by Jal Marro (Kumsa Diriba) in the West Wollegga, Anfilo woreda region, taking control of territory held by the OLF. No info on casualties.

In late February 2020, government federal troops arrested and beat a civilian man in Guliso, Nekemte, on suspicions of being associated with the OLF. He was severely injured in the attack and can no longer walk.

18 February 2020: Afar militiamen launched a series of attacks into ethnically Somali villages, firing on unarmed civilians. One person was killed, and a second injured in the attack. These attacks took place in Masulu town, near Danlaheylay (could not be located).
17 February 2020: Riots and general 'unrest' in Gurafarda woreda, Bench Maji zone, led to the arrest of several woreda officials. Further details about this event are unclear. [size=no report]

actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Oromo Regional Special Forces
notes: 16 February 2020: Oromia Special police forces state attacked OLF supporters celebrating an office opening in Wolanchiti, East Shewa, killing one and injuring several others. Vehicles were damaged during the attack.

Around 15 February 2020, intra-communal violence was reported in the Nuer zone area, SNNPR, resulted in 12 fatalities and some 21 injured. Violence erupted after the killing of a local administrator (included in the fatality count).

actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Oromia State Police

11 February 2020: Afari militants attacked the Somali town of Danlahelay in the Sitti zone area (Somali), sparking armed clashes with armed locals. Two Somalis were wounded in the attack.
10 February 2020: Ethiopian federal troops were accused of detaining and then torturing a civilian individual in Werder town, Dollo zone of Somali region.

9 February 2020: Tens of thousands of people took to the streets in Jimma, Oromia, protesting remarks made by the leader of the Oromo Federal Congress (OFC) in a recent conference. [size=tens of thousands]

6 February 2020: Oromo ethnic militias attacked the Somali town of Tulu Guled, in Fafan district, prompting clashes with armed Somali militias who came to defend the town. At least one person (Somali) was killed, and 5 wounded before the attackers retreated.

5 February 2020: Protesters gathered in 22 section of Addis Ababa, protesting the killing of 2 persons a few hours prior in a vacant lot. Police fired tear gas to disperse the protesters. [size=no report]
5 February 2020: Police forces forcibly removed people campaining for a church to be built in an empty lot in 22 area of Addis Ababa, shooting and killing 2 in the process. [size=no report]

4 February 2020: Oromo militiamen attacked the Somali town of Tuur Caanood, located near Tulu Guled town, sparking fierce clashes. At least two Oromo militiamen were killed and a third wounded.

Arrests: 27 January 2020: Authorities conducted mass arrests of OLF political supporters in Finchawa, and Shambu town of Horo-Guduru Wallaga Zone.

26 January 2020: 3 Afar communal militiamen were shot and wounded by Somali ethnic forces in Garbo Ciise (Adaytu), on the border of Afar and Somali zones. Clashes over grazing areas, water, and other resources are common in the area.

26 January 2020: Armed Oromo militiamen attacked Somali pastoralists in Tulu Guled (Fafan, Somali), prompting armed clashes between the two groups. Ethiopian federal troops later took control of the area. No injuries or fatalities were reported.

25 January 2020: Students at Gondor university protested the kidnap and dissapearance of several ethnically Amhara students from Dembi Dolo several weeks ago. Police intervened and arrested several of the protesters. [size=no report]

25 January 2020: Two ethnic Amhara brothers were killed by unidentified armed gunmen in Teppi city, Debub Bench, SNNPR. Government offices were later closed and a curfew imposed by the gunmen, who made threats via social media.
25 January 2020: Oromo youth rioters clashed with Ethiopian police in Ejaji, West Shewa, following a holiday celebration. 4 police officers and 2 youth were wounded. [size=no report]
25 January 2020: Oromo militias clashed with Somali militiamen in Tulu Guled area of Somali/Oromia border region, causing at least one injury.

24 January 2020: Government officials at the Kebele level accused the Gumuz People Democratic Party (GPDR) of instigating an attack on civilians in Kong Kabele, Wenbera woreda, killing at least 8. Arrests were later made. An addtonal 14 people are still missing and feared dead.
23 January 2020: In Abomsa town, Arsi zone, clashes erupted between groups of rioters during the Temket celebration, leading to the death of 4 people. [size=no report]

actor2: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Liyu Police
notes: 23 January 2020: Liyu police forces (Somali) opened fire on protesters in Dhobaweyn, Korahe district, Somali zone, killing one person and injuring several more. Protests were sparked after police arrested a prominate Shaykh. [size=no report]
23 January 2020: Afar militants attacked Somali herders at Masule border town in the Somali region, sparking clashes that resulted in at least one injury.
22 January 2020: Police forces shot and killed one person after rioters clashed with police in Gonder city during Timket celebrations. [size=no report]
On 21 January 2020, 5 civilian men were shot and killed execution-style by federal troops in Dolla, near Mugi, west Wollega.

21 January 2020: Rioters clashed in Harar city during the Timket (baptism) celebration, causing at least 19 injuries. Many of the injured were police officers, who intervened in the situation before it got out of hand. 20 arrests were later made. During the riot, political offices of the Oromo Federal Congress were ransacked. [size=no report]
Circa 20 January 2020: Government forces clashed with unidentified armed groups in Seba Boru woreda, Guji zone (Oromia), displacing hundreds. No further info.

20 January 2020: Rioters clashed in Dira Dawa city during a part of the Timket celebration, leaving several injured and one killed. Clashes were instigated over the tri-color Ethiopian flag, a point of contention for many Oromo living in the city. Many of the injured were police officers attempting to separate the clashing groups. At least 7 of the injured were reported as having gunshot wounds. Oromia media network reported that some of its reporters were attacked while covering the event. [size=no report]

15-18 January 2020: Demonstrators along the Mekelle/Samre road in Hintalo Woreda blocked roads and refused to allow traffic to pass for 4 days, protesting the creation of a new woreda administrative rearrangement that merged Hintalo Wereda with Hiwane wereda. [size=no report]

10 January 2020: A student was killed during a riot at Hawassa university. No reason for the riot was reported. [size=no report]

10 January 2020: Security forces fired on protesting students at Bule Hora university, killing one and injuring at least 12 others. Protesters were demonstrating against action taken by military forces in West Wollega. [size=at least 13]

7 January 2020: Unidentified armed men shot and killed two children in Amaro special region of SNNPR zone. Perpetrators were said to have crossed from Guji, Oromia, leading authorities to believe that the attack could have been part of a larger conflict.
On the weekend of 5 January 2020: A road construction manager was shot and killed by unidentified armed men in Soreka city, Metema Woreda, of Gonder zone.
3 January 2020: Peaceful protests were held by Muslim protesters in Bahir Dar denouncing the burning of mosques and muslim-owned businesses in Mota town a week prior. [size=no report]
3 January 2020: Heavy truck drivers in Gondor protested a lack of security on the roads, citing a number of recent ransom-motivated kidnapping of drivers in the region. [size=no report]
2 January 2020: A protest rally was held in Asosa town, denouncing the killing of a Benishangul State regional council member the day before. [size=no report]

1 January 2020: A second year university student was killed at Wello University after being beaten by a group of unidentified students. Motives for the beating include ethnic tensions in the country, which killed two other students in nearby universities in earlier weeks. [size=no report]
1 January 2020: Unidentified armed gunmen attacked Amhara ethnic residents of Gutu Seyoma Woreda, Gobu Seyo Qebele, killing 4 and kidnapping 2 women before fleeing toward Dembi Dolo.

1 January 2020: Unidentified armed men shot and killed a Benishangul State regional council member as he travelled to Asosa from Nekemt town. A man and woman travelling in the same car were injured in the attack.

28 December 2019: Unidentified students at Dire Dawa University threw a student from a different ethnic group off the top of a university building, killing him immediately. The killed was from the Amhara ethnic group. [size=no report]

27 December 2019: Muslim worshippers took to the streets in Addis Abeba, Hawassa, Assella, Illubabor, and Jima, demonstrating against the destruction of a mosque by angry mobs in Mota town, East Gojam the week before. All protests were peaceful and no arrests were made. [size= no report]

25 December 2019: 4 police officers were killed and 2 others wounded by unidentified attackers in the Maji town, Bench Maji zone of SNNPR. Houses of Amhara ethnic residents were later burned in a similar attack.

24 December 2019: Residents in Jigjiga protest against the burning of mosques in Amhara region, Ethiopia. On 20 December 2019, a mob burnt down two mosques and a muslim-owned business center in Mota (east Gojam zone, Amhara regional state). Rioters attacked the mosques and business center after a fire started in the Ethiopian Orthodox Tewahdo Church. The cause of the church fire is not known. [size=no report]
19 December 2019: Tuk Tuk drivers (bajaj) staged a protest in Sodo in favor of Wolayta becoming an Ethiopian state. [size=hundreds]
18 December 2019: Religious groups, trade union groups, and community groups rallied in Sodo, Wolayta, in support of a Wolayta regional state. [size=no report]
16 December 2019: A woman-only rally was held in Wolayta zone (Sodo town), in support of Wolayta becoming a regional state. [size=no report]
14 December 2019: 1 student was killed and 2 others injured when they were attacked by unidentified men as they walked from university campus to the church in Shambu Wollega, Oromiya.

14 December 2019: 3 Amhara locals and 1 person of Gumz ethnicity were killed during a shootout in Manbuk town, Metakal zone, Banishangul. 3 additional people were wounded before federal troops intervened and stopped the fighting.
12 December 2019: Residents of Sodo city, Wolayta city, Sodo, demonstrated in support of President Abiy Ahmed's receiving of the Nobel Peace Prize award. [size=no report]

10 December 2019: 4 University students of Amhara ethnicity were kidnapped as they fled the university following ethnic clashes. The identity of the kindappers is unknown. Further sources have claimed that as many as 17 students were kidnapped, blaming a breakaway faction of the OLF for the violence.
9 December 2019: In East Shewa zone, Awash Fantale Woreda, East Shewa (Oromiya region), clashes between Argobba and Karrayyu (Oromo) clans resulted in two fatalities.

8 December 2019: unidentified individuals beat a student at Gondor University, causing his death a few hours later in a hospital. Ethnic tension in communities surrounding universities over the past few weeks have led to attacks on students studying in zones outside of their ethnic homelands.
8 December 2019. Campus security at Woldia University beat a third year student (ethnically Oromo), causing hospitalization. The student later died.
On 8 December 2019, one INGO staff member was shot and killed in his home when an unknown NSAG began firing in Kutala Haro Kebele (West Wellega, Oromia).
On the 5th December 2019, unidentified armed men shot and injured 4 police officers in Gebre Guracha, North Shewa. One of the injured was the head of Kayuu police dept.

On the 4th of December 2019, 2 police officers and one civilian were killed by unidentified armed men while the police attempted to arrest a suspect in East Shawa, Adama city, Adulala Boku Woreda. The suspect was accused of providing false testimony in court.

On the evening of the 26th November, 2019, two local officials were killed in Gojo town, west Oromiya, by unidentified armed gunmen. The two killed were identified as the deputy governor of the Joldu district of western Oromia, and the political head of the Goje town. OLF breakaway 'Shane' is active in the area and is supsected of being behind the attacks.

notes: Around the 26th or 27th November, 2019: An Afar Special Forces (LIYU) soldier was killed by unspecified militants near Bati town. The road going through the town was closed for at least one day following the unrest. Further details are unavailable.

On the 25th November 2019, Addis Ababa Police forces shot dead a private security guard during a large dispute over hanging of religious banners near the Rwandan Embassy (where he worked as a security guard). Three other people were injured in the event. Both the security guard and the police forces were armed.
Around the 25th November 2019, a criminal prosecution official in Neqemte town was shot and killed by unidentified armed gunmen.

On the 25th of November 2019, several students were arrested by Addis Ababa police following a protest rally on Addis Ababa campus. Protesters denounced violence facing Oromo students studying in Amhara region. [size=no report]

22 November 2019: Secondary school students demonstrated against recent violence targeting ethnically Amhara students across the country. Protesters began near the Dambacha university located in West Gojam zone, and marched to the police station after several students were arrested. Police fired bullets into the air to disperse the protesters, and at least one person was seriously injured and taken to the hospital. [size=no report]
21 November 2019: University students who were beginning a protest were quickly arrested at the Sidist (6) Kilo entrance to Addis Ababa University. No further details. [size=no report]

21 November 2019: Oromo and Afar communal militias clashed for unknown reasons in the Amibara woreda, Afar zone. At least 2 people were killed, one of whom died after being shot by Security forces that had come to stop the clashes.

21 November 2019: An Oromia regional state official (head of the Roads Authority, Oromia State) was killed by unidentified gunmen in Laale Asaabi conservation zone of Qalam Wolegga. The identity of the gunmen has not been revealed, although OLF 'Shane' militias are operating in the area.

On 16 November 2019, demonstrators blocked the road between Ambo and Addis Ababa using stones and logs after rumors circulated that Amhara ethnic students were being evacuated from the university in Ambo. Protesters blocking roads demanded that Oromo students be evacuated from Amhara region before any Amhara students were allowed to leave Oromiya region. [size=no report]

On 15 November 2019, 3 students were reportedly injured during clashes on campus at the Meqedele-Ambo university. The situation is unclear although context suggests that the clashes may have been ethnically based. [size=no report]

From 10 to 14 November 2019, rioters erected roadblocks in Dire Dawa and clashed with federal forces who were attempting to open roadways. Intermittent clashes and sporadic gunfire were reported for 5 continuous days, November 10-14. At least 2 people were seriously injured. [size=no report]

On 14 November 2019, an unidentified group of people attacked a 'zemen bus' as it traveled from Dire Dawa to Addis Ababa using rocks. The bus company recently changed its paint colors, a move seen as being political. No one was hurt in the incident. [size=no report]

On 13 November 2019, five Oromo students were attacked by local youth in Gondor who were armed with knives and other crude weapons. Some students were stabbed while others were thrown off buildings. No fatalities occurred. [size=no report]
On 13 November 2019, several Oromo students were attacked and beaten by local youth mobs in Wollo University. No fatalities reported. [size=no report]
On 13 November 2019, several students were injured as ethnically-based groups clashed on campus in Metu university, located in Illulabor, Oromiya region. [size=no report]
On 13 November 2019, 2 Orthodox churches were burned by rioters in East Hararghe zone, Oromiya region, in what appears to have been targeted violence. [size=no report]

9 November 2019: A peaceful protest was held by around 200 women in Mekele city, Tigray region, demonstrating against Gender-Based-violence. [size=hundreds]

31 October 2019: Qerro Oromo Youth protesters gathered on the main street of Ambo town as prime minister Abiy Ahmed and Defense Minister Lemma Megesa gathered to meet with local officials to discuss violence that had occurred in the city a week before. Witnesses claimed that demonstrators numbered over 10,000, all demanding that Qerroo youth representatives be included in the talks. [size=over 10000]

notes: 29 October 2019: The leader of the Amhara Fano militia group in Dera, North Shewa, was killed during a shootout with Oromiya police.

28 October 2019: Two protesters were wounded by bullets when security forces intervened in a protest/demonstration in Mojo town, East Shewa of Oromiya region. The demonstrators were asking for the people who were arrested last week to be released. [Size=no report]

28 October 2019: Workers in Mera Beta Woreda, North Shoa Zone rioted against their contracted construction company after questions about wages were left unanswered. Workers burned vehicles and equipment, with the company owner telling police that the situation was completely out of control. [size=no report]

26 October 2019: At least 16 total demonstrators were killed and many more were injured during three days of rioting in Adama city (Nazreth), Oromiya region. The fatalities occurred when private security guards guarding a local businesses opened fire on rioters who were threatening the area, some were killed during clashes with local police. Moreover, rioting youth was also reported to have attacked a news journalist reporting for VOA, seriously injuring him. 16 fatalities spread across three days (7). [size=no report]

Moreover, demonstrationing youth was also reported to have attacked a news journalist reporting for VOA, seriously injuring him. 16 fatalities spread across three days. [size=no report]

25 October 2019: demonstrations began on the 23rd, when a popular activist accused the government of attempting to expose him to harm when his guards were removed and a mob was seen heading toward his house. Most of those killed are said to have been non-Oromo ethnic peoples in Oromiya region. Demonstration locations included Shashamene. A government spokesperson confirmed that 78 fatalities occurred during the 3 days of demonstrations following the incident on the night of the 22/23. Fatalities spread across multiple locations, with unknown values spread evenly across areas with known demonstrations on the specified day. [size=no report]

25th October 2019: At least 4 people killed in demonstrations on the 25th October 2019 in Bale Robe town, Oromiya region.
